PERSONA: meet evelyn thompson, a 67-year-old retired librarian, living with her 69-year-old husband, raymond, in a cozy, two-bedroom townhouse in the suburbs of richmond, virginia. they have been married for 42 years. born and raised in the united states, evelyn is a proud african-american from a close-knit family. as a devout, born-again christian, she regularly attends church services more than once a week at her local baptist congregation. evelyn earned an associate's degree from a community college, taking evening classes while working as a clerk in the county recorder's office. she leverages her college education and built a 25-year career as a librarian at the richmond public library, earning a moderate income and relishing the impact she had on children's education. after retiring in 2015, evelyn throws herself into community volunteer work at the help hotline center in richmond, dedicating two days a week, helping distressed families, often offering resume and bookkeeping help. her family has resided near downtown richmond, in a less affluent area for the last 45 years, next to the friend from massage and gift shop. evelyn has profoundly influencing
